title: Nightly: Enabling LTO causes undefined symbols when using build-std

labels.name: T-cargo
labels.description: Relevant to the cargo team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-custom-config
labels.description: This issue requires custom config/build for rustc in some way

body:
This bug occurs when I tried to build the example [uefi app](https://rust-osdev.github.io/uefi-rs/HEAD/tutorial/app.html) in a workspace of mine that enables LTO. I was able to replicate it using a standalone project: Cargo.toml: ```toml [package] name = "bootloader-uefi" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" [profile.dev] lto = true [dependencies] log = "0.4" uefi = "0.22" uefi-services = "0.19" ``` main.rs: ```rust #![no_std] #![no_main] use log::info; use uefi::prelude::*; #[entry] fn main(_image_handle: Handle, mut system_table: SystemTable) -> Status { uefi_services::init(&mut system_table).unwrap(); info!("Hello, firmware!"); system_table.boot_services().stall(10_000_000); Status::SUCCESS } ``` I expected the crate to compile successfully, as it does when LTO is turned off. Instead, the crate fails to link correctly, with many undefined symbols not only from compiler_builtins but also some from core. I am forced to use build-std, so it could definitely be related to [this issue](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/96486), but it is slightly different in that even disabling share-generics doesn't help. The full command that I am running to attempt the build is: ``` RUST_BACKTRACE=1 RUSTFLAGS="-Zshare-generics=n" cargo build -Zbuild-std=core,compiler_builtins -Zbuild-std-features=compiler-builtins-mem --target x86_64-unknown-uefi ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.72.0-nightly (dd5d7c729 2023-06-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: dd5d7c729d4e8a59708df64002e09dbcbc4005ba commit-date: 2023-06-02 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.72.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.4 ```
Compiler output

``` Compiling bootloader-uefi v0.1.0 (/home/luke/Documents/bootloader-uefi) error: linking with rust-lld failed: exit status: 1 = note: rust-lld: error: undefined symbol: core::panicking::panic::hb163aad4ddc55c9f >>> referenced by /home/luke/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/compiler_builtins-0.1.92/src/../libm/src/math/exp.rs:129 >>>
